alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Decatur; Norton; Rawlins (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 6:17PM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MONDAY TO 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches. Northerly winds sustained at 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...In Kansas, Cheyenne, Rawlins, Decatur and Norton counties. In Nebraska, Hitchcock and Red Willow counties. * WHEN...From 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Monday to 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous to locally impossible travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow will rapidly develop across the warning area early Monday morning. Conditions will rapidly deteriorate around, or shortly after, sunrise. Heavy snow will persist throughout the day, tapering off from west to east late Monday night. Blowing snow will persist after precipitation ends. Conditions may not substantially improve until after sunrise Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Travel is not advised. Repeating, travel is not advised. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
